title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 § 950.2 - Toll rates: Rainbow, Whirlpool Rapids and Lewiston-Queenston bridges
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 § 950.2 - Toll rates: Rainbow, Whirlpool Rapids and Lewiston-Queenston bridges

State Regulations
(a) Cash
toll-one way. U.S. CAN. 1. Children under 5 years....... Free

Free
2. Pedestrians....... 25¢
25¢
3. Automobile....... 75¢
1.00
4. Trailers (passenger cars)....... 75¢
1.00
5. Taxi cab....... 75¢
1.00
6. Motorcycle....... 75¢
1.00
7. Commercial vehicles (trucks)....... 20¢
20¢
(A)

Truck rates based on gross weight per ton of vehicle
and load

Motor trucks and drive.......... per ton

Minimum charge....... 75¢
1.00
*
(The right is reserved to
examine the bill of lading to determine weight of cargo carried)
8. Wagon....... 75¢
1.00
9. Bicycle....... 25¢
25¢
10. Fire apparatus and drive....... Free

Free
11. Motor bus (engaged in daily scheduled operation over
bridge)....... $2.00
2.50
12. Motor bus and operator....... $2.00
2.50
(not engaged in daily scheduled operation over bridge).................. 2 axle
3 or more axles....... 2.50
3.00
13. Tractors (farm or commercial) and driver (no lugs
permitted)....... 75¢
1.00
14. Baby carriages....... Free

Free
15. Ambulance....... Free

Free
16. Funerals - each automobile & hearse....... 75¢
1.00
17. Commercial Float............... same
as commercial vehicles (truck)
* Operators of trucks and tractor-trailer trucks, whether
light or loaded, shall upon request of a bridge employee, permit examination of
such papers and/or documents as may be deemed necessary to determine weight of
the load being carried over the facility. (b) Commutation tolls-one way. Tokens honored on the Rainbow, Whirlpool Rapids and the

Lewiston-Queenston bridges. 40 tokens per roll, 1 roll - 20.00
26.00 (C)

Automobiles, taxis and trailers....... 1 token. (1) Book containing 80 tickets good for
three months after date of sale honored on the Rainbow, Whirlpool Rapids, and

Lewiston-Queenston bridges....... $6.50

Automobile and driver....... 3 tickets

Each additional occupant....... 1 ticket

Pedestrian....... 1 ticket or 1 token
(2) Pedestrian toll token, no expiry date, - 16 tokens - $1.30
(for pedestrian use only - not good for
passengers in vehicles)

Footnotes
* Operators of trucks and tractor-trailer trucks, whether
light or loaded, shall upon request of a bridge employee, permit examination of
such papers and/or documents as may be deemed necessary to determine weight of
the load being carried over the facility. Notes

R. & Regs. Tit. 21
§
950.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
